metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000250 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
All versions of the SDP server in BlueZ 5.46 and earlier are vulnerable to an information disclosure vulnerability which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from the bluetoothd process memory. This vulnerability lies in the processing of SDP search attribute requests. It was discovered that an information disclosure vulnerability existed in the Service Discovery Protocol (SDP) implementation in BlueZ. A physically proximate unauthenticated attacker could use this to disclose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-cups - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-hcidump - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-obexd - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-tests - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
libbluetooth3 - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bluez package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.37-0ubuntu5.1').
